runs.comm: well wide of the off stump? A real, proper wide? No
nudged to leg for a scrambled single
wide of the off stump and left alone
short, wide, Wright tries to cut but clatters it into the ground. Mistimed clobber
shot! That's a very good cut stroke indeed. Short, wide and at last Wright capitalises with a thrusting, crowd-pleasing spank
a shovel through midwicket for two more and the crowd are now alive
nudged to leg and Wright is blocked by Pollard and they really have to scamper. Fletcher fumbles and they get a run
defended firmly on the front foot

great catch by Ramdin! Wright charged, he smashed and he top-edged a skier miles into the air. Three fielders converged but Ramdin called it, and took it low on the off side, diving as it swirled late in the strong breeze
Bopara guides it to third man
that's the way to play the short ball Luke Wright. Pietersen stands tall and pulls it in front of square with orthodox beauty and power. Four
Pietersen's already on fire. Another charge down the pitch and he flicks it wide of short fine-leg for four more
cracked off the back foot out to cover
plays and misses outside off! Just a little dibbly dobbler, but it nibbled off the seam
beautiful stroke. Orthodox on-drive, dripping with class and authority. Fine shot
pulls this - into his family jewels, I fear. Perhaps not. Good, quicker ball nonetheless from Sammy
dangerous little chip short of mid-on - came charging down the pitch
clamps forward and pushes it out to the off side
defended to cover. Loopy delivery to begin with, holding back his pace
walks into a flick but finds mid-on
good length, draws him forward and he gets a thick squirty edge to the leg side
flicked to leg
flighted outside his leg stump and Pietersen breaks the midwicket ring with a clip off his toes
an easy single to point
brilliant! A punch - powerful, front-footed on-drive, on the up - down the ground. Terrific shot - one of the hardest to play
flicked this time wide of long-on
turned to short fine leg
oh hello. Pietersen's on the charge here! A thumping lofted off-drive for four, hit with a great deal of authority
down the leg side and off his legs - off his ankle. Ouch.
on-driven for four - good grief, that's the shot of the day. His hero, Sachin T, would've been proud with that. Exquisite and orthodox from Bopara
good length by Benn, just holding it back a touch, and Pietersen forces out to cover
flicked to leg
clamps down on this fuller delivery
a full toss on his legs, driven out to long-off - but Chanderpaul mis-fields
incredible power in this Pietersen sweep - a swivel and a shovel - but deep square-leg is there
nudged to leg
driven behind square for two - third man fields
tickled to short fine leg
driven to long-off
short but quick, and he turns with a flick of the wrist
defended on the front foot
and he steals a quick single to complete a tidy over
the power! The most thumping of cut-strokes straight into the hard square and it fairly pings past point for four. Deep backward point only had five yards to run but it was smashed too hard
he's timed the cover off that, too, but straight to backward point
Bopara climbs into this, driving to long-off
swept from well outside the off stump - for four! It beats short fine-leg - perfect placement. Brilliant stuff - such strong wrists
well wide - very wide indeed. Simmons losing the plot slightly here
goes for a sweep - he's got him! Simmons has his man. Pietersen went for a big sweep from outside off but top-edged it to deep square-leg
another exquisite on-drive but the fielder jogs round - to misfield! How did he miss that? An absolute shocker from Pollard. One for the post-tournament gaffes and unforgivable
very, very, very slow. 44mph on the off stump
powerfully worked to leg
rocks back and cuts hard - good use of his crease
lovely hands, really well played - a late cut, playing it high on the bat and timing it well
very slow, tickled to leg
jabs down on this good delivery outside off
chopped down out to the off side
cut to cover
drops it out for a single to cover
four more, and a cracking shot. He waited and waited for it, playing it incredibly late beneath his nose. Touch cricket, and classy cricket too
short, wide and slapped hard but Sammy is one of the better West Indian fielders and sprints round to field before flinging in a good and accurate throw.
a touch too short and he pulls but mistimes it, much to his annoyance
lofted high, high, high - and handsomely for six! Flicked over midwicket
better and straighter ball on middle stump
another cheeky paddle, but he checks the stroke - no follow-through - and as such it falls short of the boundary. And, indeed, the fielder
down the leg side and Aleem Dar has a think...before extending both arms to the horizontal position commonly associated with a wide
nurdled off his pads
firmly defended on the front foot
nudged to leg
on his legs and turned for a single
Shah steps outside leg and flogs it ungainly to the leg-side
cut out to the off side
wide of the crease from Bravo but Bopara late-cuts him
what a catch that is! Shah swivelled onto a very firm pull but Fletcher, at deep square leg, timed his jump perfectly to take it high above his head with both hands - a stunning catch!
pulled powerfully through the leg side
nudged down to third man
fuller delivery on his toes and flicked to leg
short-arm pull but only for a single
on his toes and nicely placed to the leg side
fuller and quicker delivery which he nudges for another single
turns it off middle-and-off for a single
on his legs, Collingwood nurdles (© P Collingwood)
stroked out to deep midwicket
fuller ball but again they steal a single to short fine-leg
excellent cut and they really have to motor to get two, and Bopara duly does motor
short of a length and tucked for another single. Sleepy fielding again
smashed back to the bowler who, with great awareness, swivels around and nearly clatters the ball into the non-striker's stumps. But Collingwood makes sure he's back
crunched back to the bowler
drives inside-out to long-off to bring up a 43-ball fifty
smudged to leg
he smacks it! Absolutely smacks it and very, very nearly takes out Collingwood. It was hit so far that Simmons, at long-on, nearly parried it for four
defended to mid-off
down the pitch but they only get a nurdle
reverse sweep and this could run away - but Chanderpaul makes a fine save, flicking it back to his wingman! Great work
filthy full toss but clanged through midwicket
tries to work to leg but misses, and Gayle roars an appeal on his own and up goes the finger
beaten outside off! Good, quicker ball
a stroke out to long-off for just a single and that's a very good over for West Indies as the rain begins to ease
short of a length, pulled for two. Foster's quick
cracked square of the wicket but third man runs round to field
a very neat little dab to third man. England need more than dabby singles now, though...
tries to flog this out to the off side, and does flog it - but there's no power in the stroke. It's all a bit of a drastic scramble for runs
restarts play with a drifter down the leg side called a wide
smudged through leg
got him! Another attempt to sweep, he's rapped on the pads and that's out. Perhaps sliding down the leg side, but there's no time to pontificate
a little dibbly reverse sweep. England need strong, powerful strokeplay. Not gonna happen, is it?
tickled to leg
drops this to leg and this will be tight if they attempt two. They do - Foster has to dive, he does dive, and dives well
sweeps, Benn appeals as he raps him on the pad but he's outside the line
pushed out to the off side
tries to whack it over cover, Ramdin whips off the bails - excellent keeper, Ramdin - but Foster's foot is safely back in his crease. But, it's another dot ball...
smudged through midwicket but just for a single
down the pitch and tries to crack this full toss out to the off side - misfield out in the deep! The crowd love it. Fletcher makes a comical cock-up of things and Gayle is utterly peeved
quicker ball and an excellent yorker, going down the leg side
steps down the pitch but finds extra cover
a full toss, mistimed over the top and they get two. Hectic cricket here
speared to short fine-leg. Excellent, tight delivery
carved out to the off side - nearly another mistake by Simmons! Oily grass and there was spin on the ball but he reacted well
good delivery outside off, again just a single to point
steps to leg and tries to smite it over long-on but there's no power in the stroke and mid-on swallows the catch with ease
a full toss, chopped to deep extra cover
it's four! An actual boundary hit by England as Broad pulls this powerfully, the ball spinning away from deep midwicket's dive and that's four
that's how you hit it - fabulous tonk by Broad over the top for a towering six! Much more like it
